 Check out Ebay. If you don't just HAVE TO HAVE the 10" with the 100" focal length, etc... There are a lot of cheaper scopes out there. I have on old 3.5 or 4" bushnell that I picked up at wal mart for less than $100. I still use it frequently. 
 
 There are a ton of differences as far as quality. There are commerical 8-10" scopes out there for under $500. You are not going to be looking at them at 800x, but they still should give you plenty of enjoyment.
 
 Personally, I would get a cheaper glass to play with before trying to acquire a high quality unit that you could well pay thousands for. You might also check newspapers, garage sales, etc... A lot of folks buy telescopes for themselves or their kids, use them a couple of times, then they end up in the closet. I have heard of some folks getting great deal on secondhand scopes (12" for less than $200). A reflecting telescope is little mroe than a couple of mirrors. they do not wear out.

 I pulled that old bushnell out the other day to see if it had any markings on it as far as model number and I realised that you could easily replace the mirrror that ius in there with a 6" mirror if you could find one of the correct focal length.
